page.title: 19Leisure and Recreation
page.content: Quite a few people go fishing in the River Hamps and jogging is popular as lanes are quiet and traffic free. Walking is also popular because of the nature of the countryside and good access to footpaths. In some villages there are football teams and like the pubs' darts teams, these take part in local leagues. Bird watching and nature conservation are also enjoyed and Swineholes Wood is a nature reserve where nesting sites and management schemes encourage wild life. Elsewhere in the area, some of the unimproved rough pastures and old quarry spoil heaps have been designated S.S.I.'s (Sites of Scientific Interest) because of their isolation and freedom from pesticides. Special facilities for evening classes, Bingo sessions, Youth Club, Swimming Club and Badminton are available at Waterhouses Middle School.
